taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek kleistos , closed, alluding to lip and petals that diverge only near apex, forming tube for most of their length, the flower thus appearing closed]

bio:treatment.discussion: Authors of some neotropical floras have questioned the separation of Cleistes from Pogonia; most recent North American authors have followed O. Ames (1905–1922) in recognizing Cleistes, and we prefer to do the same until a detailed study suggests otherwise. The two North American species can reproduce asexually by root shoots.
